problems.title: Check Armstrong Number
problems.description:
You are given a non-negative integer N. An Armstrong number (or narcissistic number) is a number that is equal to the sum of its own digits each raised to the power of the number of digits.

Your task is to check whether N is an Armstrong number or not.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print "YES" if N is an Armstrong number, otherwise print "NO".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
153

Sample Output
YES

Explanation:
153 = 1^3 + 5^3 + 3^3 = 1 + 125 + 27 = 153.
hintsList: First find the number of digits d. Then sum each digit^d and check if it equals n.
